TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit TaxonomyNavigation extends System.Object
public ref class TaxonomyNavigation abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides common operations related to the managed navigation feature, friendly URLs, and the taxonomy navigation cache.

remarks.para: The managed navigation feature enables the navigation menu for a website to be modeled by using a taxonomy object, as well as by providing a model for implementing friendly URLs for the website. The main classes for this feature are , which drives the navigation menus; , which extends the taxonomy TermSet class with additional navigation-related properties, and the class, which configures the settings. The static class provides additional general operations that are related to this feature.

example.para: The following example demonstrates creating a sample term set and then configuring a SharePoint web site to use Taxonomy navigation with the sample term set.

Docs.summary: Constructs a object to be used for editing navigation term sets.

remarks.para: Use this method when creating a TaxonomySession object that will be used to update a navigation term set.

The publishing "Pages" library is used as the context for site collection group permissions, and the parameter of the method is set to true to prepare for an editing operation. This method also configures the property for each object that uses the locale ID (LCID) that is obtained from the method.

Docs.summary: Returns a list of friendly URLs that use the specified publishing page as their target page.
Docs.returns: A list of friendly URLs that use the specified publishing page as their target page.

remarks.para: This method searches for all of the friendly URLs that use the specified objects as their . It returns a list of term-driven nodes where the method matches the specified SPListItem object. The search considers all active objects. It does not return nodes with friendly URLs that have been eclipsed by another term with the same friendly URL due to a naming conflict.
The returned nodes are always of type .

Docs.summary: Returns a target page URL if the input URL is a friendly URL.
Docs.returns: If the input is a friendly URL, a server-relative URL without any query parameters; otherwise, an empty string.

remarks.para: If the parameter is a friendly URL, this method returns its server-relative target URL without any query parameters. The returned data can be used to open the object. If the parameter is not a friendly URL, then an empty string is returned. This method does not return a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The must belong to the context site, and it must be a server-relative or absolute URL.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetTargetForRootFriendlyUrl (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web);
.method public static hidebysig string GetTargetForRootFriendlyUrl(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetTargetForRootFriendlyUrl (web As SPWeb) As String
public: static System::String ^ GetTargetForRootFriendlyUrl(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPWeb ^ web);
static member GetTargetForRootFriendlyUrl : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb -> string

Docs.summary: Returns the target page as a server-relative URL when the specified is configured to use a root-friendly URL.
Docs.returns: If the specified SPWeb object is configured to use a root-friendly URL, then the target page as a server-relative URL; otherwise, an empty string

remarks.para: The root-friendly URL is a site URL that renders the Welcome Page by using URL rewriting instead of redirecting to the URL of the Welcome Page. For example, if the Welcome Page is configured as http://example.com/Pages/Default.aspx, then the corresponding root friendly URL is http://example.com. If managed navigation is not enabled, then the server renders http://example.com as a 302 redirect to the welcome page.
The return value is never a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

The name of the instance as defined by the object.

Specifies whether the parent SPWeb objects should be considered if the SiteMapProvider is configured to inherit its settings via the StandardNavigationSource.InheritFromParentWeb enumeration; otherwise, null is returned when these configurations are encountered.
Docs.summary: Returns efficiently from the taxonomy navigation cache a read-only instance of a object for the specified object.
Docs.returns: A NavigationTermSet object for the specified SPWeb object if managed navigation is configured for the site; otherwise, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

remarks.para: If the NavigationTermSet object is not already in the cache, returning it may involve loading the object from and then loading the .object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.WebNavigationSettings GetWebNavigationSettings (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.WebNavigationSettings GetWebNavigationSettings(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetWebNavigationSettings (web As SPWeb) As WebNavigationSettings
public: static Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::WebNavigationSettings ^ GetWebNavigationSettings(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPWeb ^ web);
static member GetWebNavigationSettings : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb -> Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.WebNavigationSettings

Docs.param: SPWeb object from which to return a WebNavigationSettingsobject.
Docs.summary: Returns the navigation settings for the specified object as a read-only instance of the class that is efficiently obtained from the taxonomy navigation cache.

remarks.para: Since this object is fetched from the cache, the method is more efficient than calling the constructor for the WebNavigationSettings object. If the WebNavigationSettings object is not already in the cache, the system adds it. However, if the settings were recently changed during the same HTTP request, the returned settings may be out of data until the cache has been refreshed.
The GetWebNavigationSettings(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb) method returns null if there are no settings defined in the object, or if the settings are invalid.

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a specified server-relative URL can be used as the Welcome Page for the root-friendly URL.
Docs.returns: Returns true of the specified URL can be used as the target URL for the specified SPWeb object; otherwise, false

remarks.para: The following tests are performed:

item.description: The page must belong to the specified SPWeb.
The page must be in the "Pages" library.
The page must have a published version.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool SetCrawlAsFriendlyUrlPage (Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm navigationTerm, bool crawlAsFriendlyUrlPage);
.method public static hidebysig bool SetCrawlAsFriendlyUrlPage(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm navigationTerm, bool crawlAsFriendlyUrlPage) cil managed
public: static bool SetCrawlAsFriendlyUrlPage(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTerm ^ navigationTerm, bool crawlAsFriendlyUrlPage);
static member SetCrawlAsFriendlyUrlPage : Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm * bool -> bool

Docs.summary: Updates the CrawlAsFriendlyUrlPage flag on the object that is pointed to by the parameter with the specified value.
Docs.returns: true if the update to the target PublishingPage object was successful or if the page property was already in the specified state; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method assigns a Boolean property that is stored with the specified publishing page. If this property is true, then the search crawler omits the physical URL of the page from the search index because the search index already contains one or more friendly URLs for the page. If this property is false, then the page is indexed in the normal manner.

If this method returns false, the parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the parameter is not a friendly URL, the target page is invalid, the target page cannot be found, the caller does not have permissions to perform the change, or related reasons.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool TryParseFriendlyUrl (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site, string inputUrl, out Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm friendlyUrlTerm, out string[] catalogUrlSegments);

.method public static hidebysig bool TryParseFriendlyUrl(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site, string inputUrl, [out] class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm& friendlyUrlTerm, [out] string[]& catalogUrlSegments) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryParseFriendlyUrl (site As SPSite, inputUrl As String, ByRef friendlyUrlTerm As NavigationTerm, ByRef catalogUrlSegments As String()) As Boolean

public: static bool TryParseFriendlyUrl(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPSite ^ site, System::String ^ inputUrl, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTerm ^ % friendlyUrlTerm, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] cli::array <System::String ^> ^ % catalogUrlSegments);
static member TryParseFriendlyUrl : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite * string * * -> bool

Docs.param: The object that the URL belongs to.
The URL to be parsed in absolute or server-relative form.

For a root friendly URL (that is, one based on the site welcome page), this output is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). For a friendly URL or a catalog friendly URL, it returns the term that defines it. This parameter is onlymeaningful when the function returns true.

If the input URL is a catalog friendly URL, then this output array reports the additional URL segments. If the input URL is a regular friendly URL, then the array will have zero elements. If the function returns false, then the array has zero elements.
Docs.summary: Parses the specified absolute URL or server-relative URL to determine whether it is a friendly URL, a catalog friendly URL, or a root friendly URL.
Docs.returns: true if the URL is a friendly URL, catalog-friendly URL, or root URL; otherwise, false

remarks.para: If the URL is a friendly URL, a catalog friendly URL, or a root friendly URL, then this method returns true and assigns the output parameters; otherwise, it returns false.
